column5: I know it is warm but anyone know if you can still get on at Gilford?
Look at the weather and decide if you think it's still a good idea to be out on the ice...
If you go out from Gilford, don't go farther north than the abandonned fishing gear that's floating there.
I'm thinkin shorts and sandals soon with these temps.  This is an official old guy alert-----A lot of times ice does'nt get thin---it just goes rotten

Sunday the Ice was black,  Sunday Temp +16'C  Monday Temp + 16'C  Tuesday Temp +12'C   After last nights major rain there is zero water on top and the ice is white and Very Porous looking.  You figure it out from there!!!  Rick
Today is the last day Peter from CBFB is posting reports....he officially deems the ice unsafe after this.  Also hearing of more guys being rescued today.
Two guys were just rescued off of a flow today.

Is it a rescue?  Maybe some people just think it is a ride back in.  Honey i'm home. I got a ride in a helicopter today.  Maybe tomorrow it will be an air boat.  If its a west wind can you pick me up in beaverton?
LOL Glen! that's what it seems like for these people
I take it you got your answer, be safe and stay away!
Well I can't believe they would let them bring any of their fishing gear with them on the boat or helicopter, so it is a pretty expensive ride
